snippet.textDisplay:
How DARE United lose to a City team that just won the league twice on then bounce.

It’s not like United are missing their best CB & their two best midfield players.

It’s not like City have been dominant for years and outspend and spent better than United for a decade. It’s not like City spent years planning Pep’s arrival, one of the best managers in the world when he has a team with enough classy players in it.

It’s not like United had Phil Jones in defence, it’s not like their keeper’s struggled with form for the past year or so...

Fucking pundits man. 🙄

snippet.textDisplay: Fact is Man United are a shite team and club and very few if any of their players are good enough. Also, even under Ferguson they were a pace merchant team who overloaded the wings and the box and could never play possession football. It worked back then but football has changed so no surprise their pace merchant players are struggling to break down packed defences. Fact is they are absolutely shite and it won't get better until they restructure their club. It certainly won't get better under an utter clown like Solskjaer.

snippet.textDisplay: What a ludicrous assessment. I was in the crowd at Old Trafford - there was not one hint of anger towards Ole. It was not a "masterclass" by City, they didn't give us a schooling. A slip and an own goal are what separated the teams, a defensive mistake and a bad slice of luck. Yes United have a long way to go to get back to challenging, but we match-going fans are fully behind Ole. We can see what he is trying to do and needs to be given time. I don't know what these pundits have against him - maybe that a similar opportunity didn't fall their way.
snippet.textOriginal: What a ludicrous assessment. I was in the crowd at Old Trafford - there was not one hint of anger towards Ole. It was not a "masterclass" by City, they didn't give us a schooling. A slip and an own goal are what separated the teams, a defensive mistake and a bad slice of luck. Yes United have a long way to go to get back to challenging, but we match-going fans are fully behind Ole. We can see what he is trying to do and needs to be given time. I don't know what these pundits have against him - maybe that a similar opportunity didn't fall their way.

snippet.textDisplay:
What part of a “PROJECT” do people not understand! We’ve tried THE BEST managers available at the respective times, who have been there and done it at their other clubs in every competition of any note, AND IT HASN’T WORKED!

Ole WAS NOT brought in to bring about INSTANT success! He stated from day one that it was a project which would take a number of years/seasons. And what he has done so far in terms of the club itself has undoubtedly actually been very positive. Results are ALWAYS going to suffer in a period of such significant transition, but the changes that he has made are actually moving the foundations of the team in a positive direction. The 3 major signings he made have ALL come good. That’s the first time in 6+ years we have effectively invested that amount of money.

The DNA of the club has been restored. Fast, aggressive, attacking football. A FAR cry from the negative, mundane systems applied by Moyes, Jose and Van Gaal.

And ironically we are actually getting results in the big games against the big clubs. Ole has been forced to change his system due to his biggest hitter spitting his dummy out and refusing to play for the club. Pogba’s impact in his ability to unlock teams who are defensively set up to frustrate for 90 minutes - the very teams we have dropped a significant amout of points to - has been a huge miss and something that the management team are yet to find a solution to... because it definitely isnt Fred.

But, Ole is contending with a team which consists of FOUR different managers players. Who have all played in countless different systems under managers with totally contrasting philosophies and who have brought very different sub cultures to the club.

The bottom line is, he has actually started to turn around a very wayward ship. Unfortunately for us, THERE IS NO overnight fix. Jose proved that. But the foundations he has laid and the identity that he has started to create within the club both on and off the pitch are very sound indeed.

Klopp was given sufficient time to finish what he started. The board backed him, the players backed him, the fans backed him.... the rest is history.

The alternative for United right now... Poch. For me that only goes one way. Another Jose. Another Van Gal. And IF he fails to deliver... where to then...
snippet.textOriginal:

Ole WAS NOT brought in to bring about INSTANT success! He stated from day one that it was a project which would take a number of years/seasons. And what he has done so far in terms of the club itself has undoubtedly actually been very positive. Results are ALWAYS going to suffer in a period of such significant transition, but the changes that he has made are actually moving the foundations of the team in a positive direction. The 3 major signings he made have ALL come good. That’s the first time in 6+ years we have effectively invested that amount of money.

The DNA of the club has been restored. Fast, aggressive, attacking football. A FAR cry from the negative, mundane systems applied by Moyes, Jose and Van Gaal. 

And ironically we are actually getting results in the big games against the big clubs. Ole has been forced to change his system due to his biggest hitter spitting his dummy out and refusing to play for the club. Pogba’s impact in his ability to unlock teams who are defensively set up to frustrate for 90 minutes - the very teams we have dropped a significant amout of points to - has been a huge miss and something that the management team are yet to find a solution to... because it definitely isnt Fred.

But, Ole is contending with a team which consists of FOUR different managers players. Who have all played in countless different systems under managers with totally contrasting philosophies and who have brought very different sub cultures to the club.

The bottom line is, he has actually started to turn around a very wayward ship. Unfortunately for us, THERE IS NO overnight fix. Jose proved that. But the foundations he has laid and the identity that he has started to create within the club both on and off the pitch are very sound indeed.

Klopp was given sufficient time to finish what he started. The board backed him, the players backed him, the fans backed him.... the rest is history.

The alternative for United right now... Poch. For me that only goes one way. Another Jose. Another Van Gal. And IF he fails to deliver... where to then...

Our midfield at least needs to change & I still have no idea why Jones is still in this club. I understand that Lingard gets overrated a lot, but Jones? He needs to go.

snippet.textDisplay:
I agreed with most of the points. Fred has been our most consistent player and has done well. Rashford clinical and youngsters like Williams prove that we have some talent in the squad. So called experienced players not cutting it out...

What is Sir Alex doing?
Where is the Director of Football?
Why is Ole picking players not in form?

Get Poch in...
Get Van De Sar as Director of Football
Sign 2-3 players before end of Feb
Summer get 2-3 world class players in
Every window build on that buy 1-2 world class players.

United need to go back to how they used to buy and sell players.

snippet.textDisplay:
My quesion is what has Lingard did to deserve playing over Mata and why was matic benched since he got experience. He did drastic changes to the game.

And greenwood over Martial???

Well youth have to be given chances but not in every game specially games where otamendi and fernandino are playing against him, they use some force and I am sure the youngster was scared for his legs.

The other thing no tactics at all. Players are confused they are not making runs to press defenders and the worst thing is that even after conceding 3 goals and going to the break nothing has changed, I didn’t see players playing with spirit, they letting the ball to be passed several times in front of their eyes.

-Lingard out
Ole out
Poch In
Jones out
Rojo out
Lindelof Out
Greenwood Loan
James aka academy graduate loan
Tuanzabe replace lindelof
De Gea out because he concedes easy goals and doesn’t play better than Romero
Ashley young Out
Luke Shaw Out

- Buy players with energy and drive bring in poch and get trophies like golden days.
